Burak,
 
You can specify the initial grid in your simulation to include a p=
oint very close to the wall.  As long as you set the parameter "prune" to z=
ero, that gridpoint will remain in the solution as the grid is refined.
 
R=
egards,
Jeff Bergthorson

te the heat flux 
to the wall at a fixed surface temperature. At the momome=
nt I am 
calculating the heat flux from the T-gradient and the thermal 
con=
ductivity near the non-reacting wall, however,this is not too 
accurate, si=
nce the last point before the wall is not near enough to 
the wall. I also =

near the wall, but again =

reduced,

time consuming...

(perhaps 1 
micron from the wall or so), to overcome this problem? Or is th=
